players.name: Alice
memory: Bob: "Sad to hear Diana is gone so early. I think we should carefully consider who might have had a motive to target her. Let's share any observations to identify the detective or the other villager quickly."
You: "Diana's death is a shock. As a villager, I have no special abilities, so I'll be relying on all of you to help figure this out. Let's try to be as logical as possible in our discussions."
Charlie: "Bob is the mafioso. I investigated him last night. We need to vote him out now to protect the town."

You: "Charlie claims Bob is the mafia and that he investigated him. Bob remained silent. This is suspicious. If Charlie is telling the truth, Bob should have defended himself. If Charlie is lying, he might be trying to deflect suspicion from himself."

Charlie: "Bob's silence only confirms his guilt. If he were innocent, he would have spoken up to defend himself. Alice, if you doubt me, consider what Bob gains by letting Diana die and trying to stay quiet now."
